name: Linear Regression of Y on X
description:
#### Background:

A linear regression line has an equation in the form `$Y = a + bX$`, where `$X$` is the explanatory variable and `$Y$` is the dependent variable. The parameter `$b$` represents the *slope* of the line, while `$a$` is called the *intercept* (the value of `$y$` when `$x = 0$`). For more details visit the related [wikipedia page](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simple_linear_regression). --- --- #### Task: The function that you have to write accepts two list/array, `$x$` and `$y$`, representing the coordinates of the points to regress (so that, for example, the first point has coordinates (`x[0], y[0]`)). Your function should return a tuple (in Python) or an array (any other language) of two elements: `a` (intercept) and `b` (slope) in this order. You must round your result to the first 4 decimal digits #### Formula: `$x_i$` and `$y_i$` is `$x$` and `$y$` co-ordinate of `$i$`-th point; `$n$` is length of input. `$a = \dfrac{\sum x_i^2\cdot \sum y_i - \sum x_i \cdot\sum x_iy_i}{n\sum x_i^2 - (\sum x_i)^2}$` `$b = \dfrac{n\sum x_i y_i - \sum x_i \cdot \sum y_i}{n\sum x^2_i - (\sum x_i)^2}$` #### Examples: ```python regressionLine([25,30,35,40,45,50], [78,70,65,58,48,42]) == (114.381, -1.4457) regressionLine([56,42,72,36,63,47,55,49,38,42,68,60], [147,125,160,118,149,128,150,145,115,140,152,155]) == (80.7777, 1.138) ``` ```javascript regression_line([25,30,35,40,45,50], [78,70,65,58,48,42]) === [114.381, -1.4457] regressionLine([56,42,72,36,63,47,55,49,38,42,68,60], [147,125,160,118,149,128,150,145,115,140,152,155]) === [80.7777, 1.138] ``` ```ruby regressionLine([25,30,35,40,45,50], [78,70,65,58,48,42]) == [114.381, -1.4457] regressionLine([56,42,72,36,63,47,55,49,38,42,68,60], [147,125,160,118,149,128,150,145,115,140,152,155]) == [80.7777, 1.138] ``` ----
